Host_specific: Winged insects, moth larva, mosquitoes, shrimp

Blurb: These viruses infect human skin, and are closely associated with the extremely rare disease Epidermodysplasia verruciformis.
This virus is related to the viruses that cause chickenpox, herpes simplex and mononucleosis, but rarely causes symptoms in infected people.
Papillomaviruses can cause warts and papillomas in their host, often at specific sites of the body.
Influenza A is the type of flu virus that is usually responsible for larger epidemis. Its natural hosts are usuall birds.
The name is from the Greek goddess Iris whose sign was the rainbow, referring to the iridescent appearance of infected invertebrates.

Host_specific: The most famous orthopoxvirus is smallpox (which has been eradicated from humans!)

Blurb: Most human polyomavirus infections cause little or no symptoms. Diseases caused by these infections are most common among immuno-suppressed individuals.
This genus includes the herpes simplex virus species which cause cold sores and genital herpes
The Varicellovirus contains the virus species which casues chickenpox.
Infects various species of Chlamydia bacteria
This genus contains phages which infect Salmonella and E. coli
Lambda phage infect E. coli and are often used as a scientific experimentation tool
Includes Escherichia phage N4, which infects E. coli
Includes Enterobacteria phage P22, which infects Salmonella
Includes Enterobacteria phage T4, which infects E. coli
T7 phage infects most strains of E. coli, and is often used in molecular biology and synthetic biology experiments
